content.body: WPT stash docs say that it's read once. Is there any enforcement of against reading twice if the first read fails?
That is, can try to read and write if the read fails?
Should I expect an exception or `None` if there's nothing written and I try to read?
content.formatted_body: Should I expect an exception or None if there's nothing written and I try to read?

content.body: (I'm trying to make a .py file track if it has already been requested)

https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/source/testing/web-platform/tests/tools/wptserve/wptserve/stash.py#190-205 It will return `None` if there's no data. You can also take the lock (using e.g. `with stash.lock:`) if you're doing a get-or-insert operation and are worried about multiple concurrent requests.
content.formatted_body: https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/source/testing/web-platform/tests/tools/wptserve/wptserve/stash.py#190-205 It will return None if there's no data. You can also take the lock (using e.g. with stash.lock:) if you're doing a get-or-insert operation and are worried about multiple concurrent requests.

content.body: Jake Archibald: I was thinking more about browsing context reuse (and potentially annotating with origin) and in a case of A1 navigating to B navigating to A2, if A1 popups C, C should only see B and A2 if nobody is isolated. Otherwise it should only see A1.
content.formatted_body: Jake Archibald: I was thinking more about browsing context reuse (and potentially annotating with origin) and in a case of A1 navigating to B navigating to A2, if A1 popups C, C should only see B and A2 if nobody is isolated. Otherwise it should only see A1.

content.body: Jake Archibald: Supplying this mainly as an additional data point as to why it seems better to not go down that route.
content.formatted_body: Jake Archibald: Supplying this mainly as an additional data point as to why it seems better to not go down that route.

content.body:
> <@jgraham_:matrix.org> https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/source/testing/web-platform/tests/tools/wptserve/wptserve/stash.py#190-205 It will return `None` if there's no data. You can also take the lock (using e.g. `with stash.lock:`) if you're doing a get-or-insert operation and are worried about multiple concurrent requests.

Thanks. I guess I'm relying only on a timer for the making the requests sequential.

In reply to @jgraham_:matrix.org
https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/source/testing/web-platform/tests/tools/wptserve/wptserve/stash.py#190-205 It will return None if there's no data. You can also take the lock (using e.g. with stash.lock:) if you're doing a get-or-insert operation and are worried about multiple concurrent requests.
Thanks. I guess I'm relying only on a timer for the making the requests sequential.

content.body: annevk: yeah, I was initially going to try and make it so A2 could also see C, if A1 and A2 had the same isolation, but it doesn't work for a bunch of reasons.
